intro: Diphasiastrum madeirense, commonly known as the Madeiran starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Azores and Madeira Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
